üåü 1. Welcome to evmeri

What is evmeri?

evmeri is Ethiopia's premier electric vehicle (EV) charging network platform that connects EV owners with charging stations across the country. Whether you're driving a Tesla, Nissan Leaf, BMW i3, or any other electric vehicle, evmeri helps you find, navigate to, and pay for charging sessions with ease.

Why Choose evmeri?

üó∫Ô∏è Comprehensive Coverage

  • Nationwide Network: Access to charging stations across Ethiopia
  • Real-time Information: Live availability and status updates
  • Growing Network: New stations added regularly

üì± User-Friendly Experience

  • Intuitive Mobile App: Easy-to-use interface for iOS and Android
  • Web Dashboard: Comprehensive management for station owners
  • Multiple Languages: Available in English and Amharic

üí≥ Seamless Payments

  • Local Payment Methods: Support for Ethiopian payment systems
  • Secure Transactions: Bank-level security for all payments
  • Transparent Pricing: Clear pricing with no hidden fees

üîç Smart Features

  • Intelligent Search: Find stations by location, connector type, and availability
  • Turn-by-turn Navigation: GPS directions to any charging station
  • Reviews & Ratings: Community-driven station quality information

Who Can Use evmeri?

üöó EV Owners

  • Private electric vehicle owners
  • Fleet operators and businesses
  • Ride-sharing drivers with electric vehicles
  • Tourists and visitors with EVs

üè¢ Station Owners

  • Businesses wanting to offer EV charging
  • Property owners (hotels, malls, offices)
  • Government institutions
  • Charging network operators

Getting the Most from evmeri

Before You Start

  1. Download the App: Available on Google Play Store and Apple App Store
  2. Create Your Account: Quick registration with email verification
  3. Set Up Payment: Add your preferred payment method
  4. Explore Features: Familiarize yourself with the app's capabilities

Essential Tips

  • Plan Your Route: Check charging stations along your journey
  • Monitor Battery: Start looking for charging when battery reaches 20-30%
  • Have Backup Options: Always know alternative charging locations
  • Stay Updated: Enable notifications for important updates

üöÄ 2. Getting Started

System Requirements

üì± Mobile App Requirements

Android:

  • Android 6.0 (API level 23) or higher
  • 2GB RAM minimum, 4GB recommended
  • 100MB free storage space
  • GPS and internet connection

iOS:

  • iOS 12.0 or later
  • iPhone 6s or newer
  • 100MB free storage space
  • Location services enabled

üåê Web Dashboard Requirements

  • Modern web browser (Chrome 80+, Firefox 75+, Safari 13+, Edge 80+)
  • Stable internet connection
  • JavaScript enabled
  • Cookies enabled for authentication

Download and Installation

Mobile App Installation

Android (Google Play Store):

  1. Open Google Play Store on your device
  2. Search for "evmeri" or "evmeri EV charging"
  3. Tap "Install" on the official evmeri app
  4. Wait for download and installation to complete
  5. Tap "Open" to launch the app

iOS (Apple App Store):

  1. Open App Store on your iPhone/iPad
  2. Search for "evmeri" in the search tab
  3. Tap "Get" next to the evmeri app
  4. Authenticate with Face ID, Touch ID, or passcode
  5. Wait for download and installation
  6. Tap "Open" to launch the app

Alternative Installation:

  • APK Download: Available from evmeri.com for Android
  • TestFlight: Beta versions available for iOS testers

Web Dashboard Access

  1. Open your web browser
  2. Navigate to https://evmeri.com
  3. Click "Station Owner Login" or "Dashboard"
  4. No installation required - runs in browser

First-Time Setup

Account Creation

  1. Launch the App: Open evmeri on your device
  2. Choose Registration: Tap "Create Account" or "Sign Up"
  3. Select User Type:
    • EV Owner: For personal vehicle charging
    • Station Owner: For managing charging stations
  4. Fill Registration Form: 
    Required Information:
- Full Name (First and Last)
- Email Address (must be valid)
- Phone Number (Ethiopian format: +251...)
- Password (minimum 8 characters)
- Confirm Password
  5. Accept Terms: Read and accept Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
  6. Submit Registration: Tap "Create Account"

Email Verification

  1. Check Your Email: Look for verification email from evmeri
  2. Check Spam Folder: If not in inbox, check spam/junk folder
  3. Click Verification Link: Tap the link in the email
  4. Return to App: Go back to the evmeri app
  5. Login: Use your email and password to log in

Verification Troubleshooting:

  • Didn't receive email? Tap "Resend verification email"
  • Link expired? Request a new verification email
  • Wrong email? Contact support to update email address

Profile Setup

  1. Add Profile Photo: Upload a clear photo (optional but recommended)
  2. Vehicle Information (for EV owners): 
    Vehicle Details:
- Make and Model (e.g., Tesla Model 3)
- Year of Manufacture
- Battery Capacity (kWh)
- Connector Types (Type 2, CCS, CHAdeMO)
- Charging Speed Preference
  3. Location Preferences:
    • Home address (for nearby station recommendations)
    • Work address (for route planning)
    • Preferred search radius
  4. Notification Settings:
    • Charging session updates
    • Payment confirmations
    • New station alerts
    • Promotional offers

Payment Setup

  1. Navigate to Payment Settings: Go to Profile > Payment Methods
  2. Choose Payment Method:
    • Mobile Money: M-Birr, HelloCash, etc.
    • Bank Account: Direct bank transfer
    • Credit/Debit Card: Visa, Mastercard
  3. Add Payment Details: 
    For Mobile Money:
- Phone Number
- Provider (M-Birr, HelloCash, etc.)
- PIN (for verification)

For Bank Account:
- Account Number
- Bank Name
- Account Holder Name

For Credit/Debit Card:
- Card Number
- Expiry Date
- CVV Code
- Cardholder Name
  4. Verify Payment Method: Complete verification process
  5. Set Default: Choose your preferred default payment method

Initial App Tour

Home Screen Overview

  • Map View: Interactive map showing nearby charging stations
  • Search Bar: Quick search for stations by name or location
  • Filter Button: Filter stations by connector type, availability, etc.
  • Current Location: Your current position on the map
  • Station Markers: Color-coded markers indicating station status

Bottom Navigation

  • üè† Home: Map view and nearby stations
  • üîç Stations: List view of all stations
  • ‚ù§Ô∏è Favorites: Your saved favorite stations
  • ‚öôÔ∏è Settings: Account settings and app preferences

Key Features to Explore

  1. Search Functionality: Try searching for stations near you
  2. Station Details: Tap on a station marker to see details
  3. Navigation: Test the turn-by-turn directions feature
  4. QR Scanner: Locate the QR code scanner for payments
  5. Charging History: View your past charging sessions

üë§ 3. Account Management

Profile Management

Viewing Your Profile

  1. Access Profile: Tap Settings > Profile or your profile picture
  2. Profile Information Displayed: 
    Personal Information:
- Full Name
- Email Address
- Phone Number
- Profile Photo
- Account Creation Date
- Verification Status

Vehicle Information:
- Vehicle Make/Model
- Battery Capacity
- Connector Types
- Charging Preferences

Account Statistics:
- Total Charging Sessions
- Total Energy Consumed
- Total Amount Spent
- Favorite Stations Count

Editing Profile Information

  1. Navigate to Edit: Profile > Edit Profile
  2. Update Information:
    • Personal Details: Name, phone number
    • Vehicle Information: Add/remove vehicles
    • Preferences: Charging speed, connector types
    • Profile Photo: Upload new photo (max 5MB)
  3. Save Changes: Tap "Save" to update your profile
  4. Verification: Some changes may require email verification

Managing Multiple Vehicles

  1. Add Vehicle: Profile > Vehicles > Add New Vehicle
  2. Vehicle Details: 
    Required Information:
- Vehicle Make (Tesla, Nissan, BMW, etc.)
- Model (Model 3, Leaf, i3, etc.)
- Year
- Battery Capacity (kWh)
- Connector Types Supported
- Nickname (optional, e.g., "My Tesla")
  3. Set Primary Vehicle: Choose which vehicle to use for recommendations
  4. Switch Vehicles: Easily switch between vehicles for different trips
  5. Remove Vehicle: Delete vehicles you no longer own

Account Security

Password Management

  1. Change Password: Settings > Security > Change Password
  2. Current Password: Enter your current password
  3. New Password Requirements: 
    Password must contain:
- At least 8 characters
- At least one uppercase letter
- At least one lowercase letter
- At least one number
- At least one special character (!@#$%^&*)
  4. Confirm New Password: Re-enter new password
  5. Update: Tap "Change Password"

Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

  1. Enable 2FA: Settings > Security > Two-Factor Authentication
  2. Choose Method:
    • SMS: Receive codes via text message
    • Email: Receive codes via email
    • Authenticator App: Use Google Authenticator or similar
  3. Setup Process:
    • Enter phone number or email
    • Receive verification code
    • Enter code to confirm
    • Save backup codes (important!)
  4. Login with 2FA: Enter code after password during login

Account Recovery

  1. Forgot Password: Use "Forgot Password" on login screen
  2. Recovery Process:
    • Enter your email address
    • Check email for reset link
    • Click link to reset password
    • Create new password
    • Login with new password
  3. Account Locked: Contact support if account is locked
  4. Backup Codes: Use saved backup codes if 2FA device unavailable

Privacy Settings

Data Privacy Controls

  1. Privacy Settings: Settings > Privacy
  2. Location Sharing:
    • Always: For best experience (recommended)
    • While Using App: Limited functionality
    • Never: Basic functionality only
  3. Data Collection Preferences: 
    You can control:
- Usage analytics collection
- Crash report sharing
- Marketing communications
- Location history storage
- Charging pattern analysis
  4. Data Export: Request copy of your data
  5. Account Deletion: Permanently delete your account

Communication Preferences

  1. Notification Settings: Settings > Notifications
  2. Email Preferences:
    • Charging Updates: Session start/stop notifications
    • Payment Confirmations: Transaction receipts
    • Station Updates: New stations, maintenance alerts
    • Marketing: Promotional offers and news
    • Security: Login alerts, password changes
  3. Push Notifications:
    • Real-time Alerts: Charging session updates
    • Location-based: Nearby station notifications
    • Reminders: Low battery, charging complete
  4. SMS Notifications:
    • Payment Confirmations: Transaction alerts
    • Security Codes: 2FA verification
    • Emergency Alerts: Critical system notifications

Account Types and Benefits

Standard Account (Free)

Included Features:
‚úÖ Find and navigate to charging stations
‚úÖ View real-time availability
‚úÖ Basic payment processing
‚úÖ Charging history (last 30 days)
‚úÖ Customer support
‚úÖ Mobile app access
‚úÖ Unlimited charging sessions
‚úÖ Advanced station details and amenities
‚úÖ Priority customer support
‚úÖ Extended charging history (1 year)
‚úÖ Advanced route planning
‚úÖ Exclusive access to premium stations
‚úÖ Discounted charging rates
‚úÖ Carbon footprint tracking
‚úÖ Multi-vehicle management
‚úÖ Fleet analytics and reporting
‚úÖ Bulk payment options
‚úÖ Dedicated account manager
‚úÖ Custom billing and invoicing
‚úÖ API access for integration
‚úÖ Priority station access
‚úÖ Volume discounts

Contact sales for pricing

Account Verification

Email Verification

  • Required: Must verify email to use payment features
  • Process: Click link in verification email
  • Resend: Available if email not received
  • Update: Change email requires re-verification

Phone Verification

  • Optional: Recommended for security
  • Process: Receive SMS code and enter in app
  • Benefits: Enhanced security, SMS notifications
  • International: Supports international numbers

Identity Verification (for Station Owners)

Required Documents:
- Government-issued ID (passport, driver's license)
- Business registration (for businesses)
- Proof of address
- Bank account verification

Verification Process:
1. Upload clear photos of documents
2. Wait for review (1-3 business days)
3. Receive verification status
4. Access full station owner features

üîç 4. Finding Charging Stations

Using the Map Interface

Understanding the Map

The evmeri map is your primary tool for finding charging stations. Here's how to read and use it effectively:

Map Elements:

  • üü¢ Green Markers: Available stations with open connectors
  • üü° Yellow Markers: Stations with limited availability
  • üî¥ Red Markers: Busy stations (all connectors in use)
  • ‚ö´ Gray Markers: Offline or maintenance stations
  • üìç Blue Dot: Your current location
  • üîµ Blue Circle: Your location accuracy radius

Navigation Controls

  1. Zoom In/Out: Pinch to zoom or use +/- buttons
  2. Pan: Drag to move around the map
  3. Center on Location: Tap location button to center on your position
  4. Rotate: Two-finger rotation (if enabled in settings)
  5. Tilt: Two-finger vertical drag for 3D view

Station Information at a Glance

When you tap on a station marker, you'll see:

Quick Info Popup:
- Station Name
- Distance from your location
- Available connectors (e.g., "3 of 5 available")
- Connector types (Type 2, CCS, CHAdeMO)
- Pricing (per kWh or per minute)
- Rating (1-5 stars)
- "Get Directions" button
- "More Details" button

Search and Filters

Basic Search

  1. Search Bar: Tap the search bar at the top of the map
  2. Search Options: 
    You can search by:
- Station name (e.g., "EVMERI Station 1")
- Address (e.g., "Bole Road, Addis Ababa")
- Landmark (e.g., "Bole International Airport")
- Business name (e.g., "Sheraton Hotel")
- Postal code or area name
  3. Search Results: Tap on results to view station details
  4. Recent Searches: Access your recent search history

Advanced Filters

Access filters by tapping the filter icon (üîΩ) next to the search bar:

Connector Type Filter:

Available Connector Types:
‚òê Type 2 (AC charging, common in Europe/Ethiopia)
‚òê CCS (Combined Charging System, fast DC)
‚òê CHAdeMO (Japanese fast charging standard)
‚òê Tesla Supercharger (Tesla vehicles only)
‚òê Type 1 (AC charging, older standard)
‚òê Schuko (Standard household plug, slow)

Charging Speed Filter:

Speed Categories:
‚òê Slow (3-7 kW) - Overnight charging
‚òê Fast (7-22 kW) - 2-4 hours for full charge
‚òê Rapid (22-50 kW) - 30-60 minutes
‚òê Ultra-rapid (50+ kW) - 15-30 minutes

Availability Filter:

Availability Status:
‚òê Available now (green markers only)
‚òê Limited availability (yellow markers)
‚òê Show all stations (including busy ones)
‚òê 24/7 stations only
‚òê Currently open stations

Amenities Filter:

Station Amenities:
‚òê Parking available
‚òê Restrooms
‚òê WiFi
‚òê Restaurant/Caf√©
‚òê Shopping
‚òê ATM
‚òê Covered parking
‚òê Security cameras
‚òê Wheelchair accessible

Distance and Pricing:

Distance Range:
- Within 1 km
- Within 5 km
- Within 10 km
- Within 25 km
- Custom range (slider)

Price Range:
- Under 5 ETB/kWh
- 5-10 ETB/kWh
- 10-15 ETB/kWh
- Above 15 ETB/kWh
- Custom range (slider)

Saved Searches

  1. Save Search: After applying filters, tap "Save Search"
  2. Name Your Search: Give it a descriptive name (e.g., "Fast chargers near work")
  3. Quick Access: Access saved searches from the search menu
  4. Notifications: Get alerts when new stations match your saved searches

Station List View

Switching to List View

  1. Bottom Navigation: Tap "Stations" in the bottom navigation
  2. List Toggle: Or tap the list icon on the map screen
  3. Sort Options: Choose how to sort the station list

List View Features

Each Station Card Shows:
- Station photo (if available)
- Station name and address
- Distance from your location
- Real-time availability (e.g., "3 of 5 available")
- Connector types with icons
- Price per kWh
- Star rating and review count
- Amenities icons
- "Navigate" and "Details" buttons

Sorting Options

  • Distance: Closest stations first (default)
  • Price: Cheapest charging rates first
  • Rating: Highest rated stations first
  • Availability: Most available connectors first
  • Recently Added: Newest stations first
  • Alphabetical: A-Z by station name

Quick Actions from List

  • Tap Station Card: View detailed information
  • Tap Navigate: Start turn-by-turn directions
  • Tap Call: Call station support (if available)
  • Swipe Right: Add to favorites
  • Swipe Left: Hide station (temporarily)

üß≠ 5. Navigation & Directions

Getting Directions

Starting Navigation

  1. From Station Details: Tap "Navigate" or "Get Directions"
  2. From Map: Tap station marker, then "Navigate"
  3. From List View: Tap "Navigate" button on station card
  4. Voice Command: Say "Navigate to [station name]" (if enabled)

Navigation Options

Route Preferences:
üöó Fastest Route - Minimize travel time
üõ£Ô∏è Shortest Route - Minimize distance
‚ö° EV Optimized - Consider battery range
üåø Eco Route - Most energy efficient
üö´ Avoid Tolls - Skip toll roads
üöß Avoid Traffic - Real-time traffic avoidance

Before You Start

evmeri provides pre-navigation information:

Pre-Navigation Checklist:
- Current battery level check
- Estimated arrival battery level
- Route distance and time
- Traffic conditions
- Weather alerts
- Station availability confirmation
- Alternative stations along route

Turn-by-Turn Navigation

Navigation Interface

Navigation Screen Elements:
- Large map with route highlighted
- Next turn instruction at top
- Distance to next turn
- Estimated arrival time
- Current speed
- Speed limit (where available)
- Battery level indicator
- Station availability status

Voice Guidance

evmeri provides clear voice instructions:

Voice Instruction Examples:
- "In 500 meters, turn right onto Bole Road"
- "Continue straight for 2 kilometers"
- "Take the second exit at the roundabout"
- "You have arrived at EVMERI Station 1"
- "Charging station is on your left"
- "Battery level low, alternative station available"

Voice Settings:

  • Language: English or Amharic
  • Voice Type: Male or female voice
  • Volume: Adjustable volume levels
  • Frequency: How often instructions are repeated
  • Mute: Turn off voice guidance

‚ö° 6. Charging Your Vehicle

Starting a Charging Session

Preparation Steps

  1. Arrive at Station: Park in designated EV charging spot
  2. Check Connector: Ensure connector matches your vehicle
  3. Open Charging Port: Unlock and open your vehicle's charging port
  4. Inspect Equipment: Check cable and connector for damage

Payment and Authentication

  1. Open evmeri App: Launch the app on your phone
  2. Scan QR Code: Use app to scan QR code on charging station
  3. Select Connector: Choose the connector you want to use
  4. Choose Payment Method: Select from your saved payment methods
  5. Set Charging Amount: 
    Charging Options:
- Charge by kWh (e.g., 20 kWh)
- Charge by time (e.g., 2 hours)
- Charge by amount (e.g., 100 ETB)
- Charge to percentage (e.g., 80%)
- Full charge (to 100%)
  6. Confirm Payment: Review and confirm charging session

Connecting Your Vehicle

  1. Remove Connector: Take connector from charging station
  2. Align Properly: Line up connector with your vehicle's port
  3. Insert Firmly: Push connector in until it clicks/locks
  4. Verify Connection: Check that connector is secure
  5. Start Charging: Tap "Start Charging" in the app

During Charging

Monitoring Your Session

The evmeri app provides real-time charging information:

Live Charging Data:
- Current charging power (kW)
- Energy delivered so far (kWh)
- Current battery percentage
- Estimated time to completion
- Cost accumulated so far
- Charging curve graph
- Session duration

Charging Status Indicators

  • üü¢ Charging: Active charging in progress
  • üü° Preparing: Initializing charging session
  • üîµ Paused: Charging temporarily paused
  • üî¥ Error: Charging stopped due to error
  • ‚úÖ Complete: Charging session finished

Remote Monitoring

  • Push Notifications: Receive updates on your phone
  • Session Alerts: Notifications for start, pause, complete
  • Error Notifications: Immediate alerts for any issues
  • Completion Reminder: Alert when charging is nearly done

Stopping a Charging Session

Normal Session End

  1. Session Complete: Charging stops automatically when target reached
  2. App Notification: Receive completion notification
  3. Final Payment: Automatic payment processing
  4. Receipt: Digital receipt sent to email

Manual Session Stop

  1. Open App: Access your active charging session
  2. Stop Charging: Tap "Stop Charging" button
  3. Confirm Stop: Confirm you want to end session
  4. Wait for Unlock: Connector will unlock automatically
  5. Disconnect Cable: Remove connector from vehicle
  6. Return Connector: Place connector back in station holder

Emergency Stop

  • Emergency Button: Press red emergency stop on station
  • App Emergency: Use emergency stop in app
  • Manual Disconnect: Some vehicles allow manual release
  • Contact Support: Call support if connector won't release

Charging Etiquette

Best Practices

  • Don't Overstay: Move your vehicle promptly when charging complete
  • Park Properly: Stay within designated charging bay lines
  • Cable Management: Keep charging cable off the ground
  • Report Issues: Report broken or damaged equipment
  • Be Considerate: Don't block access for other users
  • Clean Up: Leave the area clean for the next user

Charging Courtesy

  • Share Fast Chargers: Use fast chargers only when needed
  • 80% Rule: Consider stopping at 80% on fast chargers
  • Communication: Leave contact info if you'll be away
  • Queue Respect: Honor informal queuing systems
  • Help Others: Assist new EV owners when possible

Troubleshooting Charging Issues

Common Problems and Solutions

Connector Won't Fit:

  • Check connector type compatibility
  • Ensure charging port is fully open
  • Remove any debris from port
  • Try different connector if available

Charging Won't Start:

  • Verify payment method is valid
  • Check internet connection
  • Ensure connector is fully inserted
  • Try restarting the session
  • Contact station support

Slow Charging Speed:

  • Check if other vehicles are sharing power
  • Verify your vehicle's maximum charging rate
  • Consider battery temperature effects
  • Check if battery is nearly full (charging slows near 100%)

Session Interrupted:

  • Check for error messages in app
  • Verify vehicle is still connected
  • Check for power outages
  • Try restarting the session
  • Contact support if problem persists

üí≥ 7. Payment & Billing

Payment Methods

Supported Payment Options

evmeri supports various payment methods popular in Ethiopia:

Mobile Money:

  • M-Birr: Ethiopia's leading mobile money service
  • HelloCash: Popular mobile payment platform
  • Amole: Dashen Bank's mobile money service
  • CBE Birr: Commercial Bank of Ethiopia mobile money

Bank Cards:

  • Visa: International and local Visa cards
  • Mastercard: International and local Mastercard
  • Local Bank Cards: Ethiopian bank debit/credit cards

Bank Transfer:

  • Direct Bank Transfer: Transfer from your bank account
  • Internet Banking: Online banking integration
  • RTGS: Real-time gross settlement

Adding Payment Methods

  1. Access Payment Settings: Profile > Payment Methods
  2. Add New Method: Tap "Add Payment Method"
  3. Choose Type: Select mobile money, card, or bank transfer
  4. Enter Details: 
    For Mobile Money:
- Phone number
- Provider selection
- PIN verification

For Bank Cards:
- Card number
- Expiry date
- CVV code
- Cardholder name

For Bank Transfer:
- Account number
- Bank name
- Account holder name
- Branch code
  5. Verify Method: Complete verification process
  6. Set as Default: Choose default payment method

Transaction Process

Pre-Authorization

Before charging begins:

Authorization Process:
1. Payment method is verified
2. Estimated amount is pre-authorized
3. Funds are temporarily held
4. Charging session can begin
5. Final amount charged after session
6. Unused funds are released

Real-Time Billing

During charging session:

Live Cost Tracking:
- Current cost displayed in app
- Updates every 30 seconds
- Estimated final cost shown
- Ability to set spending limits
- Alerts when approaching limit

Final Settlement

After charging completes:

Settlement Process:
1. Final energy consumption calculated
2. Actual cost determined
3. Pre-authorization adjusted
4. Final payment processed
5. Receipt generated and sent
6. Refund issued if overpaid

Billing and Receipts

Digital Receipts

Every transaction generates a detailed receipt:

Receipt Information:
- Transaction ID and date/time
- Station name and location
- Connector type and number
- Session start/end times
- Energy consumed (kWh)
- Charging duration
- Cost breakdown
- Payment method used
- Tax information
- Carbon footprint data

Receipt Delivery

Receipt Options:
üìß Email: Sent to registered email address
üì± In-App: Available in transaction history
üíæ Download: PDF download option
üìÑ Print: Print-friendly format
‚òÅÔ∏è Cloud Storage: Auto-sync to cloud services

Monthly Statements

For regular users, evmeri provides monthly summaries:

Monthly Statement Includes:
- Total charging sessions
- Total energy consumed
- Total amount spent
- Average cost per session
- Most used stations
- Charging patterns analysis
- Environmental impact summary
- Recommendations for savings

‚≠ê 8. Reviews & Ratings

Understanding the Review System

Review Components

evmeri uses a comprehensive 5-star rating system:

Overall Rating Categories:
‚≠ê Overall Experience (1-5 stars)
‚ö° Charging Speed (1-5 stars)
üìç Location Convenience (1-5 stars)
üè¢ Amenities Quality (1-5 stars)
üí∞ Value for Money (1-5 stars)
üõ†Ô∏è Equipment Condition (1-5 stars)

Review Visibility

Who Can See Reviews:
- All evmeri users (public reviews)
- Station owners (for their stations)
- evmeri support team (for quality control)
- Anonymous aggregated data for analytics

Writing Reviews

When to Write Reviews

Best Times to Review:
- Immediately after charging session
- Within 24 hours of visit
- After multiple visits to same station
- When experiencing exceptional service
- When encountering problems

How to Write a Review

  1. Access Review Option:
    • From charging session completion screen
    • Station details page > "Write Review"
    • Charging history > Select session > "Review"
    • Search for station > "Add Review"
  2. Rate Your Experience: 
    Rating Guidelines:
‚≠ê 1 Star: Poor - Major problems, wouldn't recommend
‚≠ê‚≠ê 2 Stars: Below Average - Several issues
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 3 Stars: Average - Acceptable but room for improvement
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 4 Stars: Good - Minor issues, would recommend
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê 5 Stars: Excellent - Outstanding experience
  3. Write Your Review: 
    Review Writing Tips:
- Be specific and detailed
- Mention charging speed experienced
- Describe station condition
- Note amenities used
- Include helpful tips for other users
- Be honest and fair
- Avoid personal attacks

Review Categories and Examples

Charging Speed Reviews:

Good Example:
"Fast charging worked perfectly. Got 45 kWh in 35 minutes on the CCS connector. Station delivered the advertised 150 kW speed throughout most of the session."

What to Include:

  • Actual charging speed experienced
  • Connector type used
  • Time taken for your charging session
  • Comparison to advertised speeds
  • Any speed variations during session

Location Convenience:

Good Example:
"Perfect location next to shopping center. Easy to find with clear signage. Plenty of parking spaces and well-lit area. Safe to charge even at night."

What to Include:

  • Ease of finding the station
  • Parking availability
  • Safety and lighting
  • Nearby amenities
  • Accessibility features

Review Guidelines

Review Standards

Acceptable Content:
‚úÖ Honest experiences and opinions
‚úÖ Specific details about charging session
‚úÖ Helpful tips for other users
‚úÖ Constructive criticism
‚úÖ Praise for good service
‚úÖ Technical information about charging

Prohibited Content:
‚ùå Personal attacks or harassment
‚ùå Discriminatory language
‚ùå False or misleading information
‚ùå Spam or promotional content
‚ùå Off-topic discussions
‚ùå Private personal information

Review Moderation

Moderation Process:
- Automated screening for prohibited content
- Community reporting system
- Manual review of flagged content
- Response from station owners allowed
- Appeals process for removed reviews
- Regular quality audits

Charging History

Viewing Charging History

  1. Access History: Settings > Charging History
  2. Filter Options: 
    Filter by:
- Date range (last week, month, year, custom)
- Station name or location
- Payment method used
- Amount spent range
- Energy consumed range
- Session duration
- Charging speed
  3. Sort Options:
    • Most recent first (default)
    • Oldest first
    • Highest cost first
    • Longest session first
    • By station name

Session Details

Each charging session record includes:

Session Information:
- Date and time (start/end)
- Station name and location
- Connector type and number
- Energy consumed (kWh)
- Session duration
- Average charging speed
- Total cost
- Payment method
- Receipt download link
- Photos (if taken during session)
- Notes (if added)

üè¢ 10. Station Owner Guide

Getting Started as a Station Owner

Registration Process

  1. Create Account: Register as "Station Owner" during signup
  2. Business Verification: 
    Required Documents:
- Business registration certificate
- Tax identification number
- Proof of business address
- Bank account details
- Identity verification
- Property ownership/lease agreement
  3. Profile Completion: Complete business profile with company details
  4. Verification Review: Wait for evmeri team verification (1-3 business days)
  5. Account Activation: Receive confirmation and access to dashboard

Station Setup

  1. Add Station: Use web dashboard to add new charging station
  2. Station Information: 
    Required Details:
- Station name and description
- Complete address
- GPS coordinates (auto-detected)
- Operating hours
- Contact information
- Access instructions
- Parking details
  3. Connector Configuration: 
    For Each Connector:
- Connector type (Type 2, CCS, CHAdeMO, etc.)
- Maximum power output (kW)
- Pricing structure
- Availability status
- Maintenance schedule
  4. Amenities: Add available amenities (restrooms, WiFi, food, etc.)
  5. Photos: Upload high-quality photos of station and surroundings

Station Management

Dashboard Overview

The station owner dashboard provides:

Dashboard Features:
üìä Real-time usage statistics
üí∞ Revenue tracking and analytics
‚ö° Connector status monitoring
üë• User reviews and ratings
üìà Performance metrics
üîß Maintenance scheduling
üí≥ Payment processing
üì± Mobile app integration

Pricing Management

  1. Pricing Models: 
    Available Options:
- Per kWh pricing (recommended)
- Per minute pricing
- Flat session fee
- Tiered pricing (different rates by time)
- Dynamic pricing (peak/off-peak)
- Membership discounts
  2. Setting Prices:
    • Navigate to Station > Pricing
    • Select pricing model
    • Set rates for each connector type
    • Configure time-based pricing if needed
    • Set minimum and maximum session amounts
    • Save and activate pricing

Revenue and Analytics

Revenue Tracking:
- Daily, weekly, monthly revenue
- Revenue per connector
- Average session value
- Peak usage times
- Customer retention rates
- Comparison with other stations

- Total sessions per day/week/month

- Popular charging times

üîß 13. Troubleshooting

Common App Issues

App Won't Start or Crashes

Symptoms: App crashes on startup, freezes, or won't open

Solutions:

  1. Force Close and Restart:
    • Android: Recent apps > Swipe up on evmeri app
    • iOS: Double-tap home button > Swipe up on evmeri app
    • Reopen the app
  2. Clear App Cache:
    • Android: Settings > Apps > evmeri > Storage > Clear Cache
    • iOS: Delete and reinstall the app
  3. Update the App:
    • Check app store for available updates
    • Install latest version
  4. Restart Device: Power off and restart your phone
  5. Reinstall App: Delete and download fresh copy from app store

Map Not Loading or Showing Blank

Symptoms: Map appears blank, stations not showing, or map won't load

Solutions:

  1. Check Internet Connection:
    • Verify WiFi or mobile data is working
    • Try switching between WiFi and mobile data
    • Test internet with other apps
  2. Enable Location Services:
    • Android: Settings > Location > App permissions > evmeri > Allow
    • iOS: Settings > Privacy > Location Services > evmeri > While Using App
  3. Clear Map Cache:
    • Go to Settings > Clear Map Cache
    • Restart the app
  4. Check GPS Signal:
    • Go outdoors for better GPS reception
    • Wait a few minutes for GPS to acquire signal

Login Issues

Symptoms: Can't log in, "Invalid credentials" error, or login screen loops

Solutions:

  1. Verify Credentials:
    • Double-check email address spelling
    • Ensure password is correct (case-sensitive)
    • Try typing password manually instead of auto-fill
  2. Check Account Status:
    • Verify email address is confirmed
    • Check spam folder for verification email
    • Ensure account is not suspended
  3. Reset Password:
    • Tap "Forgot Password" on login screen
    • Enter your email address
    • Check email for reset instructions
    • Create new password
  4. Clear App Data:
    • Log out completely
    • Clear app cache and data
    • Restart app and try logging in again

Charging Issues

QR Code Won't Scan

Symptoms: QR scanner doesn't recognize code or scanning fails

Solutions:

  1. Improve Scanning Conditions:
    • Clean camera lens
    • Ensure good lighting
    • Hold phone steady
    • Position QR code within scanner frame
  2. Use Flashlight:
    • Tap flashlight icon in scanner
    • Improve visibility of QR code
  3. Manual Entry:
    • Tap "Enter Code Manually"
    • Type station code from QR code
  4. Check QR Code Condition:
    • Ensure QR code is not damaged
    • Clean QR code surface if dirty
    • Report damaged QR codes to station support

Payment Failed

Symptoms: Payment doesn't process, error messages, or charging won't start

Solutions:

  1. Verify Payment Method:
    • Check card/account balance
    • Verify payment method details are correct
    • Ensure payment method is not expired
    • Try alternative payment method
  2. Check Internet Connection:
    • Ensure stable internet connection
    • Try switching networks
    • Wait and retry payment
  3. Contact Bank/Provider:
    • Check if payment was blocked by bank
    • Verify international transactions are enabled
    • Contact mobile money provider if using mobile payment
  4. Retry Payment:
    • Wait 5-10 minutes
    • Try payment again
    • Use different payment method if available

Charging Session Won't Start

Symptoms: Payment successful but charging doesn't begin

Solutions:

  1. Check Physical Connection:
    • Ensure connector is fully inserted
    • Listen for click/lock sound
    • Check connector compatibility
    • Try removing and reconnecting
  2. Verify Vehicle Status:
    • Ensure vehicle is unlocked
    • Check vehicle charging settings
    • Verify charging port is open
    • Check vehicle display for errors
  3. Station Status:
    • Check if connector shows as available in app
    • Look for error lights on station
    • Try different connector if available
    • Report issue to station support
  4. App Actions:
    • Try stopping and restarting session
    • Refresh app and check session status
    • Contact customer support

Performance Issues

App Running Slowly

Solutions:

  • Close Background Apps: Free up device memory
  • Restart Device: Clear temporary files and refresh system
  • Update App: Install latest version with performance improvements
  • Clear Cache: Remove temporary app data
  • Check Storage: Ensure device has sufficient free space
  • Disable Animations: Turn off visual effects in app settings

High Battery Drain

Solutions:

  • Location Settings: Set location to "While Using App" instead of "Always"
  • Background Refresh: Disable background app refresh
  • Notifications: Reduce notification frequency
  • Screen Brightness: Lower screen brightness when using app
  • Close When Not Needed: Fully close app when not in use

Getting Additional Help

In-App Support

  1. Help Center: Settings > Help & Support
  2. Report Issue: Settings > Report a Problem
  3. Live Chat: Available during business hours
  4. FAQ Section: Common questions and answers

Contact Support

Support Channels:
üìß Email: support@evmeri.com
üìû Phone: +251-11-XXX-XXXX (Business hours)
üí¨ Live Chat: Available in app and website
üåê Website: https://evmeri.com/support
üì± Social Media: @evmeri on Twitter, Facebook

Emergency Support

  • 24/7 Emergency Line: +251-11-XXX-XXXX
  • Emergency Button: Use emergency button in app
  • Station Emergency: Contact station operator directly
  • Local Authorities: Contact local emergency services if needed

üõ°Ô∏è 14. Safety & Best Practices

Charging Safety Guidelines

Before Charging

  1. Inspect Equipment:
    • Check charging cable for damage, cracks, or exposed wires
    • Ensure connector is clean and dry
    • Verify charging station is in good condition
    • Look for any warning signs or notices
  2. Vehicle Preparation:
    • Park properly within designated charging bay
    • Turn off vehicle engine/motor
    • Engage parking brake
    • Ensure charging port is accessible
  3. Environmental Check:
    • Avoid charging in extreme weather conditions
    • Ensure area is well-ventilated
    • Check for standing water or flooding
    • Verify adequate lighting for safe operation

During Charging

Safety Practices:
‚ö†Ô∏è Never leave charging cable on the ground
‚ö†Ô∏è Don't force connectors if they don't fit easily
‚ö†Ô∏è Avoid touching electrical contacts
‚ö†Ô∏è Keep children away from charging equipment
‚ö†Ô∏è Don't use damaged or wet equipment
‚ö†Ô∏è Stay alert to unusual sounds or smells
‚ö†Ô∏è Don't attempt repairs yourself

Emergency Procedures

  1. If You Smell Gas or Burning:
    • Immediately stop charging session
    • Move away from the vehicle and station
    • Call emergency services
    • Do not use electrical switches
    • Evacuate the area if necessary
  2. If Connector Gets Stuck:
    • Do not force removal
    • Try stopping session through app
    • Check vehicle unlock procedures
    • Contact station support
    • Call evmeri emergency line if needed
  3. Electrical Emergency:
    • Do not touch anyone being electrocuted
    • Turn off power at main breaker if safe to do so
    • Call emergency services immediately
    • Use emergency stop button on station
    • Clear the area of other people

Quality Assurance & Reliability

Platform Testing & Quality

evmeri maintains the highest quality standards to ensure a reliable charging experience:

  • üß™ Comprehensive Testing: Over 100 automated tests covering all functionality
  • üîí Security Audits: Regular security testing and vulnerability assessments
  • üì± Device Compatibility: Tested on multiple devices and operating systems
  • üåê API Reliability: Backend services tested for 99.9% uptime
  • ‚ö° Performance Optimization: Load testing ensures fast response times
  • üîÑ Integration Testing: End-to-end functionality verification
  • üë• User Experience Testing: Regular usability testing with real users
  • üöÄ Continuous Deployment: Automated testing before every release

Data Accuracy & Real-Time Updates

Quality Metrics:
üìä Station Data Accuracy: 99.5%
‚ö° Real-Time Updates: Every 30 seconds
üîÑ System Uptime: 99.9%
üì± App Performance: <2 second load times
üõ°Ô∏è Security Score: A+ rating
üìà User Satisfaction: 4.8/5 stars
üîß Bug Resolution: <24 hours
üìû Support Response: <1 hour

  • Regular Updates: Monthly app updates with improvements and fixes
  • Proactive Maintenance: Scheduled maintenance to prevent issues

Personal Safety

Station Security

  • Choose Well-Lit Stations: Especially for night charging
  • Stay Aware: Be conscious of your surroundings
  • Lock Your Vehicle: Secure vehicle while charging
  • Don't Leave Valuables Visible: Remove or hide valuable items
  • Trust Your Instincts: Leave if you feel unsafe
  • Inform Others: Let someone know your charging location

Weather Considerations

Weather Safety:
‚òÄÔ∏è Hot Weather:
- Avoid charging during peak heat hours
- Stay hydrated while waiting
- Use shade when available
- Monitor vehicle temperature

üåßÔ∏è Rainy Weather:
- Use covered charging stations when possible
- Keep connectors dry
- Wear appropriate footwear
- Be extra cautious on wet surfaces

‚ùÑÔ∏è Cold Weather:
- Allow extra time for charging
- Keep emergency supplies in vehicle
- Dress warmly for outdoor charging
- Monitor battery performance

‚õàÔ∏è Severe Weather:
- Avoid charging during thunderstorms
- Seek shelter if weather deteriorates
- Monitor weather alerts
- Have backup charging plans

Vehicle Maintenance

Charging Port Care

  • Keep Clean: Regularly clean charging port contacts
  • Inspect Regularly: Check for damage or corrosion
  • Protect from Elements: Close port cover when not in use
  • Professional Service: Have port serviced during regular maintenance

Battery Health

Battery Best Practices:
üîã Optimal Charging Range: Keep battery between 20-80% for daily use
üîã Avoid Deep Discharge: Don't let battery go below 10%
üîã Temperature Management: Avoid extreme hot/cold charging
üîã Regular Use: Drive vehicle regularly to maintain battery health
üîã Software Updates: Keep vehicle software updated
üîã Professional Checks: Include battery in regular vehicle service

Data and Privacy Safety

Account Security

  • Strong Passwords: Use unique, complex passwords
  • Two-Factor Authentication: Enable 2FA for added security
  • Regular Updates: Keep app updated to latest version
  • Secure Networks: Use trusted WiFi networks
  • Log Out: Log out on shared devices
  • Monitor Activity: Review account activity regularly

Payment Security

Payment Safety:
üí≥ Secure Payment Methods: Use trusted payment providers
üí≥ Monitor Transactions: Review all charging payments
üí≥ Report Issues: Immediately report unauthorized charges
üí≥ Secure Storage: Don't save payment info on shared devices
üí≥ Regular Checks: Review monthly statements
üí≥ Fraud Alerts: Enable payment fraud notifications

Community Guidelines

Charging Etiquette

  • Don't Overstay: Move vehicle promptly when charging complete
  • Park Properly: Stay within designated charging spaces
  • Be Considerate: Don't block access for other users
  • Share Information: Help other EV owners when possible
  • Report Issues: Report broken equipment or problems
  • Keep Clean: Leave charging area clean for next user

Environmental Responsibility

  • Reduce Waste: Minimize packaging and disposable items
  • Proper Disposal: Dispose of waste in designated areas
  • Energy Efficiency: Use energy-efficient charging practices
  • Sustainable Transport: Combine trips to reduce overall energy use
  • Support Green Energy: Choose stations powered by renewable energy

    Information to Provide:
- Your account email address
- Device type and operating system
- App version number
- Description of the issue
- Steps you've already tried
- Screenshots or error messages
- Station ID (if applicable)
- Transaction ID (for payment issues)

  • Phone: +251-11-XXX-XXXX (Emergency)
  • When to Call:
    • Safety emergencies at charging stations
    • Vehicle stuck at charging station
    • Electrical hazards or equipment malfunction
    • Personal safety concerns
    • Urgent technical issues preventing vehicle operation
  • Emergency App Feature: Use emergency button in app for immediate assistance

    • Station-Specific Support

    • Station Contact Info: Available on each station's detail page
    • Station Owner Support: Direct contact with station operators
    • Local Emergency Services: Contact local authorities for serious emergencies

    Feedback and Suggestions

    How to Provide Feedback

    1. In-App Feedback: Settings > Send Feedback

    3. App Store Reviews: Rate and review on Google Play/App Store
    4. Social Media: Connect with us on social platforms
    5. User Surveys: Participate in periodic user surveys

üìã 16. Terms & Privacy

Terms of Service

Acceptance of Terms

By using the evmeri application and services, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use our services.

Service Description

  • Platform Service: evmeri provides a platform connecting EV owners with charging station operators
  • Information Service: Real-time information about charging station availability and pricing
  • Payment Processing: Secure payment processing for charging sessions
  • Navigation Service: GPS navigation to charging stations
  • Community Features: Reviews, ratings, and user-generated content

User Responsibilities

User Obligations:
‚úÖ Provide accurate account information
‚úÖ Maintain account security
‚úÖ Use services lawfully and responsibly
‚úÖ Respect other users and station owners
‚úÖ Follow charging station rules and guidelines
‚úÖ Pay for services used
‚úÖ Report issues and violations
‚úÖ Keep app updated for security

Prohibited Activities

Prohibited Actions:
‚ùå Fraudulent or unauthorized use
‚ùå Sharing account credentials
‚ùå Interfering with service operation
‚ùå Posting false or misleading information
‚ùå Harassment or abusive behavior
‚ùå Violation of intellectual property rights
‚ùå Attempting to hack or breach security
‚ùå Commercial use without authorization

Privacy Policy

Information We Collect

Data Collection:
üì± Account Information: Name, email, phone number
üìç Location Data: GPS coordinates for station discovery
üí≥ Payment Information: Payment method details (encrypted)
üöó Vehicle Information: Vehicle type and charging preferences
üìä Usage Data: App usage patterns and charging history
üì± Device Information: Device type, OS version, app version
üìß Communications: Support interactions and feedback

How We Use Your Information

  • Service Provision: Provide and improve our services
  • Personalization: Customize user experience and recommendations
  • Payment Processing: Process payments and prevent fraud
  • Communication: Send service updates and support responses
  • Analytics: Analyze usage patterns to improve services
  • Safety: Ensure platform safety and security
  • Legal Compliance: Comply with legal obligations

Information Sharing

We Share Information With:
üè¢ Station Owners: Basic usage data for their stations
üí≥ Payment Processors: Payment information for transaction processing
üîß Service Providers: Third-party services that help operate our platform
üìä Analytics Partners: Aggregated, anonymized data for analytics
‚öñÔ∏è Legal Authorities: When required by law or legal process
ü§ù Business Partners: With your consent for specific services

We Do NOT:
‚ùå Sell personal information to third parties
‚ùå Share detailed location history without consent
‚ùå Provide personal information for marketing by others
‚ùå Share payment details beyond necessary processing

Data Security

  • Encryption: All data transmitted using industry-standard encryption
  • Secure Storage: Data stored in secure, access-controlled environments
  • Access Controls: Strict access controls for employee data access
  • Regular Audits: Regular security audits and vulnerability assessments
  • Incident Response: Comprehensive data breach response procedures

User Rights

Data Rights

  • Access: Request copy of your personal data
  • Correction: Update or correct inaccurate information
  • Deletion: Request deletion of your personal data
  • Portability: Export your data in machine-readable format
  • Restriction: Limit how we process your data
  • Objection: Object to certain types of data processing

Account Management

  1. Account Deletion:
    • Request account deletion through app settings
    • Data will be deleted within 30 days
    • Some data may be retained for legal compliance
    • Deletion is irreversible
  2. Data Export:
    • Request data export through app or email
    • Receive data in JSON or CSV format
    • Includes all personal data and usage history
    • Delivered within 30 days

Legal Information

Limitation of Liability

evmeri provides a platform service and is not responsible for:

  • Charging station availability or functionality
  • Vehicle damage during charging
  • Third-party payment processing issues
  • Accuracy of user-generated content
  • Service interruptions beyond our control

Governing Law

  • Jurisdiction: Laws of Ethiopia govern these terms
  • Dispute Resolution: Disputes resolved in Ethiopian courts
  • Language: English version of terms takes precedence
  • Severability: Invalid provisions don't affect remaining terms

Changes to Terms

  • Notification: Users notified of material changes
  • Effective Date: Changes effective 30 days after notification
  • Continued Use: Continued use constitutes acceptance
  • Opt-Out: Users may delete account if they disagree
